newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Thai baht onshore and offshore rates meet.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht onshore and offshore rates meet.

text.p: The onshore and offshore rates for the Thai baht met on Monday morning around the 30.40 level with both trading as low as the 30.60 level for a time.
This is the first time the rates have touched since the two-tier market came into existence at the end of the May following Thailand's imposition of capital controls.

Thailand slapped capital controls on the market in a draconian move to starve overseas speculators of baht liquidity so they could not short the currency further. It also meant those holding short positions could not cover.
The Thai central bank this morning moved in with intervention to stem another decline in the currency and said later it would continue to take action to stabilise the baht.
It also said that around 30 baht to the U.S. dollar was an "appropriate level."
